title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a news quiz to gauge readers' knowledge of recent Greater Boston stories.
The quiz is designed to keep individuals informed about trending topics in the Greater Boston area.
Peter Chianca, a seasoned editor, oversees the quiz as Boston.com's general assignment editor.

title: MBTA Hingham ferry service canceled for Feb. 13 due to ice in the harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The MBTA canceled Hingham/Hull ferry service on Feb. 13 due to thick ice in Boston Harbor.
Shuttle buses will replace ferry service, running from Nantasket Beach to Hull Ferry Terminal from 6:30 a.m. to 10:35 p.m.
Recent winter storm caused heavy snow and ice, leading to more ferry cancellations than the past few winters.

title: Retired Gloucester firefighter dies days after being struck by Lowell police cruiser
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Daniel Kennedy, a retired Gloucester firefighter, died after being struck by a Lowell police cruiser near UMass Lowell.
Kennedy was hospitalized following the incident on Wilder Street and succumbed to his injuries nearly a week later.
An investigation led by Middlesex District Attorney Marian Ryan and Massachusetts State Police is currently underway.

title: 5 players on Red Sox’ roster bubble entering spring training
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Triston Casas may start the 2026 season in Triple-A due to recovery from a prior injury and competition at first base.
Kristian Campbell is likely to begin in Triple-A Worcester due to inconsistency and defensive issues despite past success.
Pitchers Payton Tolle and Connelly Early might not make Opening Day roster due to a crowded Red Sox pitching lineup.

title: Plans confirmed for new ICE facility in N.H.; documents reveal state officials knew for weeks
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: State documents confirm New Hampshire officials knew about plans for a new ICE facility as early as January 12.
Merrimack officials were unaware of the facility plans until reported by The Washington Post in December 2025.
DNCR Commissioner Sarah Stewart resigned after taking responsibility for not informing the governor about the plans.

title: Ex-Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia isn’t panicking over Will Campbell’s play
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel confirms Will Campbell will remain left tackle for the 2026 season despite struggles.
Ex-coach Dante Scarnecchia supports keeping Campbell at left tackle, citing his promising performance prior to injury.
Pro Bowl tackle Terron Armstead offers offseason workout to help Campbell address technique issues at his position.

title: Video: Mike Vrabel shares message to distraught Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel expressed optimism to the Patriots after their Super Bowl LX loss to the Seattle Seahawks, emphasizing future potential.
Vrabel maintained his postgame tradition of greeting players, encouraging unity despite the 29-13 defeat at Levi's Stadium.
Patriots finished the 2025 season with a 14-win record, a significant improvement from the previous year's four wins.

title: Patriots reportedly make changes to coaching staff, move Williams to ‘high-ranking’ role
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots promote Terrell Williams to high-ranking role, opening defensive coordinator position for Zak Kuhr.
Williams, now cancer-free, took a leave of absence for health issues but returned for Super Bowl LX.
Kuhr led Patriots' defense as interim play-caller, ranking fourth in NFL in points allowed during the season.

title: Pittsfield man, 69, killed in hit-and-run crash that dragged him ‘lengthy distance,’ DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Colbert, 69, was killed in a hit-and-run in Pittsfield, dragged under a car for a lengthy distance.
The incident occurred near Linden Street and Francis Avenue, involving a dark-colored sedan that fled the scene.
Pittsfield police urge anyone with information or surveillance video to contact them via provided emails or phone numbers.

title: ‘This is only the beginning’: Ann Michael Maye shares encouraging message after Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots lost 29-13 to the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX, ending their remarkable postseason run.
Quarterback Drake Maye set a Super Bowl record with 235 passing yards in a single quarter.
Ann Michael Maye, Drake's wife, shared an encouraging message, calling the season 'incredible' and emphasizing future potential.
